```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# Install packages
library(tidyverse)
library(tidytext)
install.packages("gutenbergr")
library(gutenbergr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(wordcloud2)
library(viridisLite)
```

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# Read in data
read.csv("navy_comms.csv")
read.csv("navy_extra.csv")

# load in texts
battle <- read_lines("https://www.gutenberg.org/files/54441/54441-0.txt", skip = 214)
head(battle, 10)

battle_txt <- tibble(text=battle)
head(battle_txt)

tidy_battle <- battle_txt %>%
  unnest_tokens(word, text)

tidy_battle

navybook <- read_lines("https://www.gutenberg.org/cache/epub/41677/pg41677.txt", skip = 264)
head(navybook, 10)

navybook_txt <- tibble(text=navybook)
head(navybook_txt)

tidy_navy <- navybook_txt %>%
  unnest_tokens(word, text)

tidy_navy

flag <- read_lines("https://www.gutenberg.org/cache/epub/19849/pg19849.txt", skip = 426)
head(flag, 10)

flag_txt <- tibble(text=flag)
head(flag_txt)

tidy_flag <- flag_txt %>%
  unnest_tokens(word, text)

tidy_flag

```



## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r tidy, include=FALSE}
tidy_battle <-  tidy_battle %>%
  anti_join(stop_words) 

tidy_navy <-  tidy_navy %>%
  anti_join(stop_words) 

tidy_flag <-  tidy_flag %>%
  anti_join(stop_words) 
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r countbattle, echo=FALSE}
tidy_battle %>%
  count(word, sort=TRUE)

```

```{r plotbattle, echo=FALSE}
tidy_battle %>%
  count(word, sort = TRUE) %>%
  filter(n > 100) %>%
  mutate(word = reorder(word, n)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(n, word, fill=word)) +
  geom_col() +
  labs(title='Word frequency for The British Navy in Battle',
       y = NULL, x= "word count") +
  theme(legend.position="none")
```

```{r countnavy}

```

```{r cloudbattle}
colour_pal <- turbo(n=100)

wc_data <- tidy_battle %>%
  count(word)  %>%
  filter(n > 10)   # only include words that appear more than ten times
wordcloud2(wc_data, shape='circle', size=0.5, color=colour_pal)
```
